Reviews.Title: “Good For a weekend Get-away”
Reviews.Author: Paige J
Reviews.Content: First, the location of this place is superb. Literally steps away from everything you could want in the village. Turn right and you get the gay district, turn left and you get the Latin Quarter. We didn't have to walk more than ten minutes to get anywhere, the bars, clubs, restaurants, and two metro stations are within a ten minute walk. The hotel looks a little disjoint because I think they are working on making it nicer. However, the rooms are nice and fairly clean. For such an inexpensive hotel in such a prime location I was expecting something much worse. They brought warm croissants and french bread with juices and spreads and hot coffee in the morning as a wake-up call. There were some homeless people outside, but I never felt unsafe, its just the price you pay for being in a large city. There was some confusion at check-in, and the gentleman implied that it was my fault that they had it in the system wrong, but once I was able to show him the price online he relented. That was only 2 minutes of bad service out of all my interactions, which were otherwise GREAT. I would definitely come back and recommend it to friends. I don't know that I'd bring a family there, but for a weekend going out on the town, you can't beat the price/location combo.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this quaint hotel !!!!”
Reviews.Author: NelsonNewYork
Reviews.Content: Whenever I am in Montreal, I always stay at this hotel. I was just there in late December. The hotel rates are inexpensive. The place is in the heart of downtown Montreal so you can go shopping, go walking and the Metro is nearby. Walking distance to Chinatown area and HSBC Bank. The reception area is open 24 hours and always staffed with such friendly employees. The staff all speak English as well. I love the Continental Breakfast which is served right at your room at the time you desire. The hotel is situated within a large Gay community so there are many Gay clubs and bars in the area. .Every room has a refrigerator and there is plenty of heat in the rooms. The bus depot to the airport is walking distance, so need for a cab. I highly recommend this place !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: hburkholder
Reviews.Content: The first two times my husband and I stayed there (in 2005 and 2009) we were just charmed with this place - inexpensive, nothing fancy but still nice & clean, friendly staff, and a delicious breakfast served at your door - just great! Then the last time we were there in 2010, our experience just was a bit too weird for us to feel safe there any more. First off there were people having sex right in the back of the building (which I know they can't always control, but still - just giving you an idea of what you can witness when parking your car in the back). The room was lacklustre at best, it was old and dingy, weird smelling (carpet moulding perhaps?) and not clean. The bathroom as just disastrous. So I think from this point on we're going to stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but it depends on what you expect”
Reviews.Author: joelgomez
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Saint Andre Hotel in the last week of November. Here is my take. Location was perhaps one of the best to be. When you visit Montreal, you want to be near where everything else is. At least I do. Location was great. It is located in a downtown area, so expect to see some homeless people at night, some police activity and some drunken fights here and there. Hey, you chose to visit Montreal right? that's all part of the big city. The hotel itself itself is not bad. Its about a 2 star. I am am not very picky and did not expect much. I was not dissapointed. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and simple. Fine with me. The FREE breakfast, is not breakfast at all. Its toast and coffee. Its an insult to most Americans, but at least they bring it to your room at whatever time you choose. So, you don't have to leave your room to have your morning coffee. This hotel appears to be visited by a lot of young people. I am 40 years old and I am ok with that, but if you are going there expecting to have very quiet nights, perhaps you should go somewhere else. The staff was probably the most helpful I have ever experienced anywhere. They are very, very helpful and are willing to do just about anything for you. Overall, its not bad. Great price. Right in the middle of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Benedict N
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel after reading all the reviews posted here by the internet community. I should say that I am not disappointed by decesion, but rather well pleased. Firstly, the hotel staff are friendly, they gave me a map and lots of information about the Montreal city.Rooms decently furnished, restroom is clean and breakfast complimentary. I spent around $114 for two days and nights, it was worth it. Will surely recommend others and will stay there if I visit the city again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, reasonable, and steps from Ste. Catherine”
Reviews.Author: KSWilson24
Reviews.Content: When we booked this hotel, it was last minute, and we expected to get what one pays for as usual. but we were pleasantly surprised! Granted, it's not the Ritz, the rooms were not resplendant with opulance and luxury, but they were roomy, clean, and quiet. The bathroom was roomy and also clean. Unlike many hotels in the price range, a working elevator is available. The TV was newer flat screen, and of reasonable size. Breakfast is brought to your room at the time you chose. It is mostly breads with a few spreads, and a hot drink and juice. The staff are friendly, and willing to share information regarding the city. We found them pleasant and personable. A vietnamese restaurant is just across the street, and many other places to eat, as well as various stores are within a few minutes walk. Rue-Berie UQM metro station is less then three blocks away. Would I come back? Yep...hard to beat the price for the central location and the decent, and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Kazoo22
Reviews.Content: This little hotel has five star service in a one star building. The staff were terrific - friendly and helpful. Our room was on the first floor - it was quiet and comfortable but threadbare with some dust in the corners, the bathroom was fine. Location was great - we walked to old Montreal and beyond. Yes parking was tight but it was included and off the street. Breakfast was continental plus juice; the bread and coffee were excellent. (If you want more food there's an IGA market right around the corner on St. Catherine.) Lastly, the neighborhood is interesting. The hotel is 50 steps from Rue St. Catherine. Then to the west you have pretty traditional stuff, restaurants an outdoor music venue, and a subway station. To the east you have the gay district and related entertainment. Everything felt safe. The Google Earth pictures of the street in front of this hotel are aweful - don't pay any attention to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: TimSolo
Reviews.Content: The location is superb--a short walk from the metro, right off of St. Catherine St. in the heart of the Village, and within walking distance of most sights in the city. The rooms are clean, the breakfast (included and brought to the room) is great, and the staff is helpful and friendly. Anyone who says the neighborhood is seedy hasn't traveled very much; it's not dicey at all. I would stay here again and recommend this place to anyone. It's a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is developing”
Reviews.Author: DimitriB
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a bit hard to find and parking is very difficult. The outside looks very old and needs some maintenance, the inside looks very well. It seems the owners are renovating room by room. Rooms at the ground floor look still old fashioned but on the third floor they look very good (I do not know anything about the other floors). I suspect our room on the ground floor to have bed bugs. This hotel does not have a breakfast room so the staff brings you the breakfast to your room and this breakfast was very good. That is a nice service. Location is also very good. You can walk to the city center in about 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Great value.”
Reviews.Author: fenchurch128
Reviews.Content: Here's the simple reason why I booked this hotel: free parking! This was the only place I could find with free parking that wasn't miles away from the sites of Montreal. We drove into town, but wanted to leave the car and just walk the city from the hotel every day, and I can vouch for this being the perfect location to do just that! Yes, the parking lot is small. But need I mention again that it's FREE? Yes, the hotel is a little run down. There was some peeling paint in our room, and it's a little eccentric that the elevator doesn't run all the way to the fourth floor. (Take note if you have any issues with stairs-- you'll need a room on the third floor or lower.) I figure you get what you pay for, though. And we paid very little for a comfortable bed in a great, fun neighborhood, very near the metro. The staff was very nice and helpful, the shower was hot, and overall this was exactly what we expected for the price. I didn't go to Montreal to sit around in my hotel all day and be pampered-- I came to see the city! So this place was perfect. I'll definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Unpleasant hotel in unpleasant area”
Reviews.Author: CoupleOfHoliday
Reviews.Content: The hotel is near a subway. Thatâ€™s what there is to say on the positive side. On the negative though, there is a lot to say. The hotel is located in an unpleasant area (dirty streets and buildings, many homeless, people getting arrested) and walking to the hotel even from the subway feels unsafe, though better than walking from Old Town / Downtown. It probably gets even worse if you go further east, but next time weâ€™d look for a hotel in the Downtown area more west. For example, we were walking past Best Western Ville Marie, where the area looked much nicer. The parking lot is - like other reviewers mentioned - very tight. I had to go back and forth many times before I had my Toyota Camry parked. If you have an even bigger car, donâ€™t try to park here. And I wouldnâ€™t be surprised if lots of cars get damaged here while people try to squeeze their cars in and out.. The room we got was very hot, moist and not clean. The air conditioning didnâ€™t do anything, so we asked for another room. The guy from the lobby didnâ€™t seem to be very much interested in our request at first, but eventually found us another room. It was on the top floor, which was renovated. Although the room was much better, it was still very sober and old and it was still not worth the price. We had a terrible pillows (with â€œchunksâ€�) and the air conditioner blows right onto to the bed. We tried to cancel our second night, but since it was prepaid they wouldnâ€™t let us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price-quality”
Reviews.Author: Katmo79
Reviews.Content: I was welcomed very nicely. Breakfast is served in the rooms and is included in the price : it's simple but good. The room was large with a bit old-fashioned decoration. The bathroom was smelly but after a few days of putting fragrance in the room it got better. Personally I found the location not really ideal, it's still 15min walk from the Vieux Montreal, and is East of rue St-Catherine a bit more the dodgy end. But still I really think it was a great price-value, seen the prices of accommodation in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: octanou
Reviews.Content: The place as zero charm like stated in a previous review. It is tired (seems like it depends on the room) and the AC in our room was extremely noisy. This hotel is a place to sleep, nothing more. In that regard it serve its purpose well with comfortable bed and clean room. Location is good because of its central location and proximity to UQUAM metro station. However you have to be aware that the surroundings blocks are full of beggar and some mentally ill people too. It is still safe (they can be annoying but that's it) but we were going back to the hotel quite early in the evening, i'm unsure about staying in club/bar and leaving at 2 or 3 am however. Staying 3 days, during the morning we saw : shattered car glass in the street, police and ambulance "cleaning up" something that happened in the early morning, used syringe just at the door step of the hotel. So depending on your culture background and age, it might be a great place or you might be slightly uncomfortable ... I hesitated between 3 or 4 in term of notation, i leave 3 in the end but based on price alone it could be 4. The hotel has nothing great at all (except the receptionist who was very friendly and helpful) , but its price which is very cheap for Montreal !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Mikicino
Reviews.Content: Small and little hotel in the middle of Gay area of Montreal...so if you made this selection be prepared to see pictoresque people once you come back late at night... The rooms are quite clean and confortable, breakfast is included and served in the room.

Reviews.Title: “good deal for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: Florencia d
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, you can walk to almost everypalce in the city and alternatively the subway is only 2 blocks. There were a lot of restaurants and groceries nearby also. The neighbourhood seemed very safe. Room was ok in size. Internet was good and free! Breakfast was not great (croissants were ok, but bread was bad) but it was not bad in quantity. The room was well air-conditioned. You need the air condicionted otherwise the ventilation was inexistent. But the air conditioner work fine during the 3 nights we stayed. The place was clean and the concierge was very helpful, and gave us a good descriptions of the city atractions and their locations. It has free parking, (although the spots are limited, but we were able to have one for the 3 days we were there. ALso it had a small refrigerator in the room, which was useful!! Overall experience was good and for the price it was quite good!!

Reviews.Title: “Tres bien! I'd stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: c00coo
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in Montreal and liked staying here. The location was perfect, the price was right, and the hotel was safe, clean and comfortable. I had easy access to the subway and to many locations in walking distance. The room has a refrigerator and there's a market across the street on Rue St. Catherine so it's possible to buy various food items for the stay. Air conditioning unit worked very well. The breakfast service was nice. I loved having coffee delivered to my room! The croissant was warm and tasty. I saved the bread and peanut butter for a mid-morning snack. The only issue I had was that I didn't know I was supposed to leave the tray outside the room in order to get housekeeping service that day. It didn't matter to me, I don't mind if my bed isn't made up. I almost prefer not having someone in my room. But the next day there was a note on the tray to leave it out and the room was made up.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: MariaDanmark
Reviews.Content: We liked Montreal and the hotel was located very central, and we could walk around to everything. But the hotel was poor, it was dark and the breakfast was boring. When we arrived they couldnÂ´t find us in the system. We had an e-mail from them, where they had confirmed our reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Location was very good.”
Reviews.Author: Diane Lynn
Reviews.Content: After three nights in a not-so-good hostel we switched to the Hotel Andre. It is a nice little hotel with clean rooms and a great perk - a lady brings you coffee and a baguette and croissant with juice in the morning. Also, the hotel has a parking lot, which is essential in crowded Montreal. We never drove anywhere. We walked and took the Metro for days.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: 2Historybuffs
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews, I was prepared for a borderline experience, but was happily surprised. There was a friendly receptionist. The lobby is nicely decorated, there were signs of a continuing remodel. The elevator at the end of the hall took us up to our small but clean and pleasant room. There was a bathroom with shower in the room, newly updated. The continental breakfast was routine, but delivered to the room with a cheery "bonjour". Everyone was so helpful and friendly. This is (expensive) Montreal, but the budget price was less than what we paid for a stuffy walk-up room with a shared bathroom in Ottawa. Hotel Saint Andre has a great location, too. Less than 2 blocks to the Berri metro station, you can get anywhere quickly. You could even walk to the old town. If I ever return to Montreal, I'll stay at Hotel Saint Andre.

Reviews.Title: “Do you read just the negative comments?”
Reviews.Author: GLaker
Reviews.Content: Do you find yourself reading only the negative comments when you're trying to check out a new place? I guess I'm the same way. We recently spent one night (our original plan) at Hotel St. Andre. Prior to our stay, I was concerned about some of the negative comments posted on TA. Here is what I found. If you're looking for a 5 star hotel with lavish rooms, numerous amenities, or ambiance, you better stay elsewhere. If you're looking to enjoy Montreal and need a reasonably priced hotel to sleep in, this, is, your, place. We wanted to enjoy Montreal and weren't interested in spending hours at the hotel. As a result, Hotel St. Andre fit the bill perfectly. Yes, it probably needs some updating, but the rooms were clean and functional. 5 STAR service. Roger, the man at the front desk was outstanding. If you need help, advice, reservations, suggestions, directions, Roger will pleasantly and diligently help you out. I've been to numerous hotels/resorts and I would rate Roger's helpfulness as the best. When it comes right down to it for us, when you're visiting a new location, the friendly advice/suggestions from someone in the know, like Roger's, can make or break your stay and Roger certainly made our stay pleasant. Everybody's tastes are different. We found that Hotel St. Andre served our purpose well.

Reviews.Title: “An ok experience clean safe but zero charm”
Reviews.Author: makkida
Reviews.Content: We booked a "superior" room for 2 days at Hotel St AndrÃ©. We were told our room would be large and with 2 bathroom. Indeed the room was large at it appeared obvious this was originally 2 rooms separated by a wall that was torn down. The room was clean - not always obvious even in better hotels. The bathroom is spartan with no dryer etc. If you are looking for a place to crash are are 1 or 2 days in Montreal, Hotel St andrÃ© provides a safe and clean environment. If you are looking for a nice hotel with much charm this place is not for you

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: chickaboom24
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with great customer service, decent and clean rooms, free WiFi, free parking and croissants delivered to your door each morning. A good hotel with an even better price!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for its price”
Reviews.Author: mattgwwalker
Reviews.Content: This place is clean, not expensive, well situated and the staff were friendly.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: kerr1974
Reviews.Content: We decided for my birthday to stay at this Hotel because of it's location and price - I didn't have much expectations for $70 bucks a night but I was very pleased with the service and the cleanliness - Definitely, will stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Area is a bit sketchy, but hotel is safe and nice!”
Reviews.Author: mitchcolgan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel last week by myself (26 year old single man) and I have nothing but good things to say about the hotel. True, it's not the most luxurious place I've ever stayed and the rooms are pretty stark and small. However, the value for the money was fantastic. It's located just two blocks away from the main metro station, as well as the bus stop used for the 747 bus to and from the airport. It could not be more convenient. As for the hotel, the staff was nice, and I had no problems with cleanliness, the internet worked great, and the breakfast in my room was nice. You can choose to stay at much nicer places, but for a room I really didn't spend much time in, the location was phenomenal -- especially if you are going to be spending a lot of time in the Village or traveling around on the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, at the Heart of the Village”
Reviews.Author: drgmobile
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but clean and perfectly adequate for a quick overnight trip. Great location near the heart of the Village

Reviews.Title: “Okay for the price...”
Reviews.Author: Wayne-and-Marilyn
Reviews.Content: Our room was located next to a building with loud disco type music playing into the middle of the night. The a/c was loud which help overpower the music but worked poorly. Also their wasn't much light in the bedroom; the bathroom was fine. That said, it was still worth the price with free parking, walking distance to many attractions, and a pleasant helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean and Economical”
Reviews.Author: RL24
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel on a number of occasions. The location cannot be beat and the rates are some of the lowest in the neighborhood. Lots of restaurants, bars and shopping are all around the corner. Metro stations are nearby as well. If you drive, they have free parking in the back or on the side of the hotel. Drug addicts sometimes hang out in the back of the property, but are always watched by the cameras at the Front Desk. Rooms are comfortable, very clean and even come with refrigerators. Breakfast is included in the rate and makes for a special touch when brought directly to your room. The staff is very professional and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, good location”
Reviews.Author: lauries444
Reviews.Content: Room was tiny, but nice and clean. The shower was a little gross looking, but maybe just due to old tile and grout. The location was great - walking distance to old port, and right next to major metro stop. The parking lot is extremely tight - if you have a large vehicle the only way in is to drive up the curb and maneuvering out again is definitely a project - best to leave the vehicle parked and walk or take the train to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with the neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: josehsp
Reviews.Content: Be careful, the hotel is ok but the neighborhood is dangerous,it has a lot of drugs And they donâ€™t have a save parking. because when I woke up I found two car with the broken window and one of them was mine. When I told to the manager , he stayed as if nothing had happend and that's quite normal. Donâ€™t go to this hotel unless that you donâ€™t care about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis77
Reviews.Content: Check-in and check-out were quick and easy. When I checked in the young lady at the reception desk asked for my name and quickly found my info on her computer. I paid, she gave me the key card for my room and asked me what time I would like the complimentary breakfast taken to my room in the morning. The parking is free - she gave me a parking slip to put on my car's dashboard. When I checked out I just told the receptionist my name and gave her my keycard - quick and easy. There is an elevator, so you won't have to walk up the stairs with your luggage. My room was on the 3rd floor. My room was clean and had: -a mini fridge -2 wrapped glasses -a desk and chair -a closet with 5 plastic hangers -cable TV with remote -a dresser with 3 drawers -2 nightstands -2 tabletop lamps in addition to the wall lighting -a wrapped bar of soap on the sink -a mirror in the bathroom and a mirror on the wall above the dresser (not full-length mirrors) -a shower stall -a bottle of shower gel -towels -a hardwood floor (If you prefer carpeting I think they might have some rooms with carpeted floors.) I read some reviews here before I reserved a room, so I knew it would not have a radio or alarm clock, shampoo, or conditioner. Like the hotel's web site says, there is a microwave in the lobby and if you need an iron, ironing board, or hair dryer you can ask for one at the front desk. Regarding safety, my door had a deadbolt lock and a chain lock in addition to the key card lock, and there was a smoke detector and sprinkler head in the room. The doors don't have peepholes/eyeholes though. The location is great. I walked to museums, stores, and restaurants. I enjoyed the complimentary breakfast, which includes a fresh croissant, a fresh baguette, coffee or tea, and juice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good staff but not worth it”
Reviews.Author: travelmore_8
Reviews.Content: I amstill in the room at the time of writing this review. Let's start with the positives: The hotel is located in a great location, close to the entertainment district, there is a music festival going on a couple of blocks away and the neighborhood is all nicely decked up. The manager at the reception is a friendly person and he helped us settle in quickly. The room is functional but more about it later. The manager asked when we would like the breakfast (it is served in the room). That is a nice touch. Now the negatives: While reserving the room (2 weeks in advane) I had to extend my stay by one day. I had very clearly stated at the time of extension, that I want to to stay in the same room for all the three days. During check-in I was told that I will have to change rooms. That was not a good start and there was no attempt to rectify the situation. The room is small and has a noisy air-conditioner (hope it doesnot disturb too much in the night), no soap or shampoo in the bathroom, there is also a fridge and a smallish TV but no closet. The bathroom is small with wierd soap dispensers in the shower and the wash basin. The car parking is a bit tight. Let's hope the car stays in good shape over the next few days. If you plan to book in advance on a website be careful of the taxes and fees. In my case the taxes and fees were neither added nor informed at the time of the reservation. They add up to around 25% of the room rent. But probably that is more of a comment on the reservation site easytobookodotcom than the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER EVER EVER AGAIN!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: LindsToronto
Reviews.Content: When we checked in I was happy. The girl at the desk was nice, the parking was free (although very very tight with an SUV) and the room was decent. The location is good. The next morning at 6:30 I could hear this awful noise going down the hallway and someone knocking on doors. It kept happening, at 7:30 I finally called the desk because I couldn't sleep and I was told it was the breakfast cart. It sounded like a herd of elephants. My husband decided to go to Tim Hortons to get us coffee. It was raining, and when he went outside there where men fighting and police. He came back because of the rain and the night manager stopped him and interrogated him as to where he was going. My husband said he didn't know the room number, we had checked in late the night before and came to our door. The manager called me yelling and swearing at me about the "black guy" who refused to disclose information to.. Then he decided to send two police officers to our room even though I already told him that it was my husband. My husband was not rude, he simply told him he didn't know the room number. I guess it's nice the hotel gives you breakfast but when it wakes you up at 6:30 AM and the manager is rude about it then it's not worth it. I had driven 6 hours the night before and was soooooo tired that when the cart woke me up I was pretty mad. I asked to be switched to the furthest room from the elevator but was denied. We prepaid for 2 nights with AirMiles and didn't even stay for the 2nd night and wasn't compensated. They refused to let us move rooms and they refused to give me a credit or something. I didn't redeem my miles to be woken up at 6:30AM and be yelled at by the night manager. When I went down in the morning to complain he said with a big smirk on his face " See you tomorrow 6:00AM for breakfast" Never the less, we packed up our stuff and stayed with a friend and will never ever return there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: drbMontreal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is quite well situated for visitors wanting to stay in the downtown area of Montreal. It is relatively inexpensive, and while the rooms are nothing special, they are clean and well-maintained. The hotel brings breakfast to your room at the time of your choice (between about 6:30 a.m. and 11:00 a.m.) which consists of juice, baguette, croissants and a hot beverage of your choice (coffee, tea or hot chocolate). This was a very nice touch. Staff was quite friendly both at arrival and departure. Like most hotels, though, noise in the hallways is easy to hear from the rooms. You can't hear anything from one room to another, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, nice rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PRoy89
Reviews.Content: Looking at Hotel Le Saint Andre from the outside, one is a little sketchy to go inside. Once we entered and got into our rooms, we were very impressed. Very clean, decent sized rooms. It was within walking distance of many restaurants, bars, and it was very close to the subway. Overall, a great place to stay in Montreal! Great value, I could not find a place cheaper with a better location or better reviews!

Reviews.Title: “Central location, good service...”
Reviews.Author: TugaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Central location, good overall service, cosy and breakfast in the room included...

Reviews.Title: “Great value--perfect location--clean--free parking--what more can you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: chrisb007
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. I was a little skeptical after reading some of the other reviews, but the hotel was a great surprise. The room was a pretty good size, clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful, especially Roger, the manager. No problem at all with the parking lot-it opens right to the street-disregard any concerns about safety . Free cont. breakfast delivered right on time to your room. Easy walk to old Montreal and the restaurants and pubs on St. Katherine and St. Denis streets. Great BYO restaurants on Prince Arthur St and Duluth St. Quick walk to the metro and the shops on St. Catherine St. Try the farmers market in Little Italy (by metro). If you are not a 4 star hotel type, you'll be perfectly happy.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: marg81
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay there staff very nice and helpful and i would recommend it to my friends to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A nasty place”
Reviews.Author: burglex
Reviews.Content: It's a dirty, rundown hotel similar to what you can find in any seedy rundown section of downtown of any major US city. It's nowhere near to justify the $100+/night rate they charge to stay there. This hotel have dirty, smelly rooms with unclean bathroom and bedding sheets. There is an extremely dark, narrow, and dangerous passage way to the parking area in the back which is used by homeless and drug addicts. The passage way is very dark at night and you would need to maneuver just inches away from walls and other cars to park there. If you are driving an SUV it will NOT clear it. The parking area is littered with used syringes and there were a couple of addicts shooting drugs while I was parking there. There is no soap and shampoo in the bathroom, fortunately I had these with me. There is no closet to put clothes in. There is a very old and noisy air conditioner which ruins a sleep during the night. Sound insulation is very poor, there were strange people shouting and laughing in the middle of the night in the hallway. And as they say the list goes on and on... I would never recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Best budget choice in Montreal; croissants delivered to your door each morning”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: There are few hotels that are the bargain that the Hotel Le St. Andre is. Rooms are spotless. Very quiet. Crossants and baguettes delivered to your door each morning. Just steps to the Berri Uqam metro stop. 2 coffee shops within blocks plus a great magazine store. On the downside, the rooms are a bit spartan and their is no clock radio. Friendly staff. I've been staying here for your. Two gyms (Nautilus Plus and Energie Cardio) within 2 blocks. If you are on a budget or don't like over-paying for hotels, this is your spot. ( If you are expecting a Westin or W, this is not a good pick.)

Reviews.Title: “So bad we turned around and left to go elsewhere at 10pm!”
Reviews.Author: JC_JCM
Reviews.Content: I don't know where to start with this one. We are still upset by it! The hotel carpark was so tight that I hit my car (a rental) off a pillar which was not a good start to the experience. The hotel staff upon check-in was friendly to be fair but it was all downhill from there. Maybe we should have guessed with the status of the other reviews on this site but the hotel looked ok on paper and some of the reviews were not too bad so we booked the hotel initially on that basis. The requested room was not available so instead of a double room as requested we got two adjoining rooms, not the end of the world but not a good way to start. When we tried to get a double room we were told the hotel was full and there was no other option. These things happen ... all hotels can be full. When we went to the room(s) we recoiled ... There was a bad smell coming from each of the rooms and we are still not sure what each of the smells were, and really do not want to know. The carpets were stained. There were insects in the bathrooms. There was mold on the bathroom ceiling, as well as rust on the rail holding up the none too clean looking shower curtain. As per other reviewers the place was not clean!! We used the (admittedly free and good quality internet) to get another room in another hotel and we promptly left!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, friendly staff, and good price.”
Reviews.Author: eieiei
Reviews.Content: I stayed this hotel one night when my second trip of montreal. there is no shampoo and soap in the bathroom, but shower room was pretty large. staff were friendly and helpfull. reception guy gave me a big map and told me hot spots which he recommends. breakfast was only cafe and two croissants, but it was taste so good. i wanted to ask them where did they get the croissant,,, lol i totally satisfide with this this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Fidel_Gastro
Reviews.Content: Nothing fancy. The light breakfast was adequate for my needs, and the at-your-door delivery a real convenience. One of the maids gave a free three-day Metro pass one morning. Comfortable bed, clean enough to pass my own inspection each day. The quality lies between that of the Hotel Lord Berri and the cheap places near the Berri/UQAM terminal. The price is fair in light of that, and you can't beat the location -- between the BerriQUAM and Baudry Metros. If you are gay, this is right in the middle of the bars, clubs and shops for that clientele. If you are not, like me, the neighborhood is still an interesting place to look around. -- Only one small problem: my credit card payment was not registered (or at least findable) at the desk when I checked out. No real problem, though, and the clerk took my word for the payment. Just a brief delay, handled pleasantly.

Reviews.Title: “Never coming back....”
Reviews.Author: Polie76
Reviews.Content: Bad...how bad? Bad! 1. Room is more of a hostile 2. No closet, just 3 little hangers on the wall 3. Beds are disgusting (won't pass inspection) 4. Bathroom has no shampoo, cream or place to hang a towel 5. Hotel runs out of towels 6. Breakfast is not a breakfast...it's a joke. There is no bar or restaurant, so they make you order at front desk (3 choices, bun...croissant...or croissant..lol, 1 small coffee and a boxed juice) 7. Hotel charges more then some other, better hotels and has lots of false advertising. Stay at your own risk...but it doesn't worth $93/night.

Reviews.Title: “A boutique hotel with few pretences”
Reviews.Author: SympaticoToronto
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for overall good value, do not have exalted expectations and just need a decent place to park yourself at night, the St. Andre is a generally sound choice. Although I'd not stayed there for several years, over the long haul -- more than 25 years -- I must have lodged at the St. Andre at least a 20 times or more. I've seen it go through various changes, such as the redesign of the lobby, but it has always retained its character as a modest, friendly boutique hotel with a touch -- just a touch -- of European charm; (which may explain why it tends to be favored by foreign budget travelers.) The hotel has never undergone a complete renovation. It always seems to have been piecemeal and there's always something that's likely to bother fastidious travelers. Housekeeping standards have varied over the years too. It always pays to ask if a room is renovated or not and, if you don't like stairs, which floor it's on. (The elevator is way at the east end of the building.) For my most recent stay I had No 21. It was clean (which has not been the case with all my previous visits), simply furnished, well lit, and, although on the small side by the standards of North American chain hotels, had plenty of hanging and drawer space. The queen bed was firm enough although the bedding, like the towels, is low-end stuff. The CRT television delivered a good picture (cable) and it was possible to set it as an alarm (there's no bedside clock radio). Rooms on this (north) side look into a grim alleyway which at night is brightly lit. Because there are cheap venetian blinds rather than drapes, the room can never be blacked out. A small writing desk was needlessly cluttered with a vase of cheap artificial flowers. There were two small armchairs and, a useful touch, a small bar fridge. An air conditioner beneath the window is concealed behind slide panels when not in use. The renovated bathroom was fine. It is among those where the old bathtub has been replaced by a large, tiled shower -- so large in fact that it tends to cramp the rest of bathroom, especially the crapper! There is no hairdryer, only basic soap and those rather low-end towels I mentioned. (Irons and ironing boards can be requested.) As others have mentioned, sound proofing is not good. The halls and floors creak as is common in older European hotels. But then experienced budget travelers know to carry ear-plugs (and a blindfold can be useful too). Depending on how you plan to spend your time, the location is good; very close to the Metro (Berri-UQAM) and bus station. By foot you can be almost anywhere you're likely to want to visit in the downtown area within 30 minutes. There are plenty of restaurants along St. Catherine St (immediately north of the hotel). If you turn right at the intersection you'll be heading into the gay "village." Turn left and you'll be headed towards the seedy red-light neighborhood around St. Laurent but soon pass into a more salubrious section of this long thoroughfare. Turn north off St. Catherine at St. Denis and you'll find a lively street scene with lots of cafes and small eateries. The hotel lobby is well stocked with tourist maps and informational brochures to guide you on your way. And, of course, there is something rather charming about the hotel's long-standing tradition (except when it briefly experimented with a breakfast room) of delivering a continental breakfast to your room. If you want heartier breakfast fare you don't have to walk far to get it. And if you fancy a tipple in your room, there's a liquor store only steps away, heading west on St. Catherine. Internet savvy travelers should have no problem finding a room here at a decent rate although in high season prices rise and the hotel can often be fully booked during one of the city's many festivals, especially during the jazz festival and Gay Pride weekend (yes; the St. Andre appears to be very gay friendly judging by the provision of a number of free gay publications it makes available) so it helps to plan ahead. In the off-season, you can probably get a room in the CND$70-$80 range/44-50 Euro (pretax). The St. Andre apparently has a high return rate among those who appreciate its unpretentious charm and who prefer to save their money for things other than a lavish hotel room. It will always have its detractors -- yes, there are things it could improve, at a price -- but clearly has also won itself a loyal clientele.

Reviews.Title: “Filty, dirty”
Reviews.Author: Chris2phe21
Reviews.Content: I have stayed a few times in the past at this hoted, it was ok and clean. You can't expect much for the money you pay. But my last stay was just horrible, the room was extremely dirty, stains on the bathroom walls, etc. The place must of changed hands. Would not recommend it to anyone. Even if you just need a place to crash DON'T.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended as a 2-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: eurofire
Reviews.Content: I booked this on bonjourquebec.com. I thought I was getting a deal considering it was $52 marked down from $90 regular. But after staying here, I feel that the discounted price is what the regular price should be. So if you're going to book this hotel, find a discounted room on bonjourquebec. I usually stay in 3 or 4 star hotels, but I suppose for a 2-star, this is absolutely suitable. There was not much to be desired in terms of the appearance of the hotel and my room. But the room was fairly clean and included the essentials. The bathroom actually looked nicer than the room. There isn't much parking and it's hard to get in and out of it with the tight laneway, but there is a cheap parking lot right across the street. What I really appreciated about St-Andre is the staff. I met three of them and they are wonderful! I found them to be very friendly, polite, and helpful. Having my breakfast delivered right to my door in the morning was quite a surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth staying at”
Reviews.Author: mswtophd
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely fantastic. The HÃ´tel Le St-AndrÃ© is located in the Latin Quarter of Montreal. Yes, the area was a little seedy, but the hotel is located right in the middle of the city! There is a lively scene going on- students, gay, posh, etc. You don't need a car as most things worth visiting are either withing walking distance or a quick metro ride away. The nearest metro stop is about two blocks away--if that. The service was wonderful. The front desk people were all very friendly, helpful and speak both english and french. Breakfast is delivered to your door- but you have to make sure to request a delivery time at the front desk. There is a *tiny* parking lot in the back and it is free. Yes, it does appear a little shady, but there is a video camera in the back and the person who checked us in was watching it religiously. He knew that we had parked back there before we mentioned it! Why not 5 stars? Well, the hotel is a little shabby and is by no means luxury. However, the room was spotlessly clean (and I am piiicky) and the beds were comfy. I was lucky enough to get a huge room, but I did notice that most of the rooms are teeny tiny. I would totally stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Work!”
Reviews.Author: gregw1962
Reviews.Content: The hotel was convieniently located to the attractions we were interested in but the hotel seemed to be in a state of run down. We did not feel secure finding people (homeless) sleeping in the hotel doorway and late at night the front desk was unattended and doors open to allow anyone to come and go with no problem. Our room was sufficient but needed some TLC (ie: bathroom door handle falling off and toilet seat was broken. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A great bargain”
Reviews.Author: djdawei
Reviews.Content: After reading all the mixed reviews on this site, I was nervous about staying here. But my fears were unfounded. This place turned out to be a great bargain. The location is excellent--walking distance to one of the main subway stations. The staff was courteous and helpful. Our room was clean, bed was comfortable. And breakfast was decent and always served on time.

Reviews.Title: “Had to get out of there”
Reviews.Author: DaynaNeil
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel. The rooms were very dis-tasteful and dirty. I was woken up several times during the night by other guests going up and down the noisy staircase. I would not recommend staying here to anybody. We were planning to stay there for 4 nights, but my partner and I could only handle one night! beware!

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth the (little) Money”
Reviews.Author: 123456Canada
Reviews.Content: Right off Saint Catherine Est, colourful neighbour of Montreal, full of crazyness until late in the morning. Comfortable rooms, exactly worth the few dollars spent. Breakfast in bed is a nice touch. Wonderful service, location, location location ! Perfect for the budget travellers who want to try a hotel over a hostel, a bit more money but not that much more. Glorious weekend, give this place a try, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean and convenient all for the right price.”
Reviews.Author: Larry1NewYork
Reviews.Content: Hotel St. Andre is perfectly located with fast and easy access to the Latin quarters and gay village. Everything is in walking distance. Parking is free. Room is clean and with reasonable rates. Roger, who greeted us at the front desk was friendly and helpful. I especially loved the hardwood floors. Room included cable T.V. and a great air conditioning unit. Breakfast of fresh bread, croissants and coffee brought to your room every morning. Only issue that I had was the towels. I would bring my own next time. I will definitely be back! Itâ€™s not the Ritz but itâ€™s safe, affordable and convenient. I enjoyed both Hotel St. Andre and MontrÃ©al!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, very convenient!”
Reviews.Author: jfa2424
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel, and not nearly as bad as some of the reviews on here seem to imply. I stayed here for four nights with a group of 5 other people to spend some time in Montreal and see McGill University as prospective students. It was very clean, and our room on the 3rd floor was newly renovated. The room itself was pretty spacious, the air conditioner worked well, and the staff was extremely reasonable and able to provide us with an extra mattress as we were a party of 5 and there were only enough beds for 4 people. My only complaint about the staff is that they didn't seem to know much about Montreal itself in terms of tourism, but otherwise they were very friendly and accommodating. As long as you bring your own map or guidebook, it is no problem at all. The free breakfast in the morning was really good as well - hot croissants, baguettes, orange juice, and tea or coffee brought straight to our room. It is also in a great location - a few blocks away from St. Denis at the beginning of the Gay Village. The neighborhood was not seedy at all, and it was very quiet because the hotel is down a small side street about a block from St. Catherine. I would not call it a "Red light district" at all: I think that further down St. Catherine this definition is plausible, but not near this hotel. Obviously there were a lot of night clubs around the major streets but there was never anything to worry about: we walked around at 2 AM and never felt in danger. It was also walking distance from a ton of interesting places such as Old Montreal, the Old Port, Rue St. Rue St. Laurent, St. Catherine, Chinatown, & etc. For further places the Berri-UQUAM metro was very close and accessible at almost any hour. During the summer there was tons close by - the Jazz Festival, fireworks on Canada Day, as well as a HUGE variety of night clubs, festivals, and restaurants. I normally stay in 4-5 star hotels and think that this one is just as good as the rest. It is definitely worth it for the price and I would recommend it to anyone who wants to have a great time in Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “I must have had the non-refurb room”
Reviews.Author: austinfurlvr
Reviews.Content: So I was wondering about this hotel when I booked it but I read these reviews and that put my mind at ease, and I could not have been more disappointed when I arrived... I must have gotten the only non-renovated room. As I was walking down the hall to my room - I noticed several spots on the carpet - and I dismissed it, as spilled cleaning products or something. However I entered my room, and was sad to see multiple stains on the carpet in the room. The bedspread was ancient and seemingly full of dust, as were the curtains. The paint was peeling from around the window, (which looked out onto a parking lot) I asked the front desk if I could switch rooms and they had none available. I would not recommend this hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: arawak
Reviews.Content: For the price, no reason to complain, Excellent staff, pleasant and very helpful. Good continental breakfast

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: knievel
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed here for three nights in Nov 2006. A simpel but good and warm continental breakfast of bread, pastry, juice, and coffee/tea was served in the room at your requested time each morning. The hotel's decor is a bit dark and outdated, and the room was pretty small, but it was very clean and had a tv and fridge. Bed was comfy and overnight noise was minimal from either within the hotel or outside. There was construction going on in the hotel basement during the day however. The front desk staff were very friendly and particularly helpful, and there is free (but very limited) parking available in a lot right next door. The neighborhood doesn't make the best first impression, but after a short while anyone who's ever spent time in a city will feel more at home. But when it comes down to it, you are really well located within Montreal. The main intersecting subway line is only a two minute walk, and the cafes of St. Denis aren't much further. Even the Old City and Chinatown are within walking distance, or a short subway or cab ride. It's easy to find by car. If you're going to spend a lot of time in your hotel, pay more for a nicer place, but if you'll be out and about enjoying the city this is a good place to base yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Often-Canada
Reviews.Content: This is a great little hotel with freindly and helpful staff. The rooms (recently redecorated) anare done very well. Good job all the way around, including the bathrooms which are often difficult in remodelling older hotels. The location is down a side street but very convenient to restaurents and entertainment. Fast access to the cross Montreal underground highway. AND they supply the parking. I had a small refrig (wine racks of course!) in the room. The breakfast is a continentall with a quite suffient, brought to your room -- it was right on time for me! Free wireless. A great small hotel well deserving of it's 3 star status and terrific value - having stayed in several Montreal 2 and 3 stars, I certainly recommend this one. Booked through Montreal tourist bureau -- always great service from them

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the Village & Old Mtl”
Reviews.Author: greekprince
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this place at least 10 times... its good value for your buck. They've recently renovated, so the place looks great. Rooms: Clean, renovated...can be a little chilley, but Montreal can get pretty flippin cold. Bathrooms are bit small, but the water is hot. Matresses...well used...some like it soft :) Staff: friendly & nice.... i can usually barter my room price down with the owner. Location: Awesome...near the metro...10 min walk from old mtl, and right in the Village. Complimentary breakfast: They bring it to your door in a tray & drop it off in the hall. The coffee is errr, ok...and the croissants can be stale...but its great if you got the munchies after a nite of partying :) Lots of cafe's & restaurants in the area. Good value for your buck...good location...its a nice 20 min walk to the Plateau or the shopping drag on St.Cathrine's.... I've stayed in lots of other places in Mtl...and I always come back to this place...

Reviews.Title: “Good place for your money!!”
Reviews.Author: mandarama
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for your money. How many places do you know that will deliver breakfast to your room for under $100 a night? It is walking distance to all amenities. Roger at the front desk was great. He provided anwsers to all our questions and gave good suggestions on where to go in the city. The only problem that I had with the room was that there was no hot water one morning and there was no clock whatsoever in the room. I recommend this hotel to anyone looking to save some money.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: javaandjazz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from august 18-22, 2006. The room we had was recently remodeled and very very spotlessly clean. I was a bit nervous when reading the bad reviews on this site but my fears were unfounded when we checked in and got into the room. WE stayed on the 2nd floor. It was simply decorated and very clean. The bathroom was also very clean. The hotel staff was super friendly. Ya,it was right around the corner from the gay neighborhood so if any of you guys want to stay there it's down the street from all the bars and clubs. There were lots of gay guys,straight families with children and single people staying there. Older,younger,you name it and they were there. It catered to everyone. A continental breakfast was included each morning consisting of frenc bread,a chocolate or plain crossaint,orange juice, and tea or coffee. The closest metro stop is about a 3 minute walk and 3 lines run into that station so it's very convenient. The only thing I didn't like is that the tv had no remote but by the time we got back to the room at night we would be asleep a few minutes after turning it on. I will include some room pics too. Any question please email me.

Reviews.Title: “Just be warned!”
Reviews.Author: mike3
Reviews.Content: I wish I would have believed the negative reviews posted on this website. It wasn't the worst hotel ever... you just need to be aware of its shortcomings. I will start off with the positive aspects. The hotel is in a great area (if you wanted to stay in the gay area). The hotel staff was very friendly and professional. They were also helpful when we had questions about the area and how to get to attractions in Montreal. The lobby was a little dated, but nice. The breakfast in the morning was nice. You have a choice of a regular crossaint or a chocolate crossaint; coffee, tea or hot chocolate; orange juice; and a baguette with assorted jellies and peanut butter. Just let them know what time you want it served at. Now for the bad aspects of the hotel. When we arrived, they told us to take the elevator to the second floor and then take a "quick ten steps" up to the third floor... so the elevator does not go up all the way. The hallway on the first floor seemed okay... so we were not worried. When we got to the third floor the hallway was a havest gold mustard yellowish neon color. Very ugly. The rooms are the same color. It seemed that the entire third floor is a renovated attic (why would the elevator not reach that floor?). The room itself was small (but we expected that). It was fairly clean. The bathroom was clean and nice. Listen up people: this was the MOST uncomfortable bed we have EVER slept on (or tried to sleep on). It was rock hard and the matress squeeked everytime you moved (as to wake up your partner). It was awful. We stayed four nights there and thought about sleeping on the floor instead. The ceiling in the room is one of those tile type ceilings (think school classroom). It wouldn't have been so bad if our neighbor did not smoke like a fiend (even though they were all non-smoking rooms)! The smoke poured into our room every day until they left. It was awful. While we were in Montreal, the weather was quite cold... which we love. The air conditioner didn't look like it even worked... or worked well. When we left we overheard the manager or owner talking about renovations planned for the lobby. I certainly hope they also plan on renovating that third floor. Also... the pictures on the website are of rooms on the first and second floor. The chairs pictured must have come from the lobby. No such chairs were seen in the rooms. Forget about the flower arrangement. Again, it wasn't the worst hotel ever... just be warned that you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Best for the Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Montreal, Canada we stayed at the Hotel St. Andre. We found the price well worth it for the location, amenities(Where else for the price can you get breakfest brought to your room?), friendly and helpful staff, and clean and secure location. We will certainly recommend the St. Andre to our friends and we will stay there when we return to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the place in September 05 and was very happy with overall. For the money you cannot go wrong. If you want to stay in the gay village, (and I did) it is close to it and yet walking distance to Old Montreal. I did get the free parking and the breakfast was OK. Think about how many other hotels do not include breakfast..... It was nice having the breakfast delivered to your room. One tip regarding breakfast, you have to request your next day's time of delivery each day. I did not know this and was waiting for my breakfast to be delivered and I had to call the front desk only to be informed that you must request the time of delivery each day. The place is very clean and updated. I would rank it a solid 3 star. I had never stayed in anything less than a 3 star and normally stay in 4 or 5 star, but considering what I paid and the location, I was very satisfied and would stay again. Oh, I did not see any strange people in the area. If you do not want to see gays, then don't go to Montreal. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for the price & convenient location”
Reviews.Author: igbotrevordc
Reviews.Content: We were able to book a room on relatively short notice at the Hotel le Saint Andre for our first visit to Montreal. All-in-all, we were very pleased. The location is very convenient, just off St Catherine at the west end of the Village. We were on the top floor, which does not have elevator access (odd, but not a big deal for us, since we were traveling somewhat light). The room was quite basic (not a renovated room), but it was also comfortable for the price. The staff were very friendly and helpful, from the booking stage right up to checkout. The breakfast delivered to the room (warm croissants, two cups worth of coffee person, and orange juice) was very nice! Other item of note: parking... while free off-street parking is offered, it is rather limited (about 15 spaces for the entire hotel), so beware if you are driving to Montreal as we did. We were able to get a space, but it was tricky and took navigating carefully in the tight parking lot. We definitely plan to stay here again on our next visit to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a fantastic trip to Canada which was partially ruined by our final hotel - the St Andre in Montreal. We booked months ago but were disappointed to find an extremely basic and outdated room for the cost of a decent hotel (premier lodge) in London. The walls were a nauseating yellow, the airconditioner limited and noisy, the breakfast (which is so acclaimed on this website) may be wonderful if you have been travelling in Asia but was nothing special unless you love lots of repetitive white bread products and lukewarm tea! On our first day we requested a room change as we suspected that we had simply got a poor standard room but all of the nicer updated rooms were smoking (not an option if you don't smoke unless you don't mind the smell. We also had a problem with security, a brand new dress that I had bought, disappeared - we reported it to the reception, not expecting any compensation, but thought they ought to know in case it had happened before or something and were met with unbelievable rudeness. We were practically accused of lying. Just to put this into context, we are a very polite and well travelled couple who have stayed in budget (and not so budget) accomodation all over the world, and have never experienced such a poor standard of service for a disproportionate amount of money. Also I never write these things but am so incensed by our stay that I felt I had to warn others. Stay here at your peril!

Reviews.Title: “elevators”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only problem we encouture was the elevator did not go to the 3rd floor. If we would have been inform of this,we would have book the 1st or2nd floor,which we will do next time. We are planning ti go back next year &stay at the same hotel saint-andre. I just think when people book there reservations through the internet or the hotel itself,this info should be shared with the customer.

Reviews.Title: “Not for Internet users”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine for those who wan to be in the heart of the gay scene in Montreal. The rooms are very simple and the staff is very helpful. The beds are fine, as long as you don't move since they make alot of noice! For those who need Internet access for their laptop, then they might want to check other options. They charge for each connection, min 60min. Connection is bad in some rooms. Be prepared to enter the long username and password every 10 minutes and need to reconnect to websites.

Reviews.Title: “You want to do business here !!! Stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in St. Andres wonderful Hotel April 14-17. I was compelled to write them a thank you letter. I want to the manager ( Roger) and his staff for all of your hospitality and professionalism you showed me and my friends during our three day stay in your hotel. I know it was no easy task in accommodating a party of 15 people but your staff did an amazing job. I surprised and the lavish rooms and delicious breakfast delivered every morning at a most economical price. I will recommend your hotel to all of my friends and family and look forward to visiting you in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly atmosphere - a place to relax”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel when I visited a conference in Montreal and I felt very happy there. The atmosphere was very friendly, the breakfast was served in the room and just opposite the hotel was a nice restaurant. This suited me the first days, being exhausted after the flight and the start of the conference. It was also close to the metro, with an excellent book shop. Most of the shopping in Montreal is underground. I'd love to go back to Montreal and I would be happy to stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ThomasLes
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. It is on a small, quite street. It is only a five minute walk to the main metro station. In addtion, there are many restaurants and shops near by. It is an older hotel that is well taken care of. The staff is pleasant and very helpful. I was there in March -- 2005.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Le Saint Andre
HotelInfo.Address: 1285 rue St-Andre, Montreal, Quebec H2L 3T1, Canada
